kpis.kpi: current assets to current liabilities ratio
kpis.description: This ratio measures a company's ability to cover its short-term obligations with its short-term assets. A higher ratio indicates better liquidity.

kpis.kpi: operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio
kpis.description: This ratio assesses the ability of a company to pay off its current liabilities with the cash generated from its operating activities. A higher ratio indicates better liquidity and operational efficiency.

kpis.kpi: cash flow to current liabilities ratio
kpis.description: This ratio evaluates the company's ability to cover its current liabilities with its total cash flow. It provides insight into the liquidity position of the company.

kpis.kpi: avg time taken to collect receivables ratio
kpis.description: This ratio indicates the average number of days it takes for a company to collect payments from its customers. A lower number of days is preferable as it indicates efficient collection processes.

kpis.kpi: cash and cash equivalent to liabilities ratio
kpis.description: This ratio measures the proportion of a company's total liabilities that can be covered by its cash and cash equivalents. A higher ratio indicates a stronger liquidity position.
kpis.formula: cash and cash equivalents / total liabilities
